flawed_nl_solution:
Of the under-30s there for the second band, 40% are men because 100-60=<<100-60=10>>10
There are fifty under-30s there for the second band because 20 / 0.1 = <<20/0.1=200>>200
There are 100 people there to see the second band because 200 / 0.5 = <<200/0.5=400>>400
There are 150 people at the concert because 400 / (2/3) = <<400/(2/3)=600>>600
#### 600

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 10. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
